intro: Gomphrena michelli, commonly known as the Mexican featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, feathery inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gomphrena michelli is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its showy blooms and drought tolerance.
